summary: The Defense Against Drones Act of 2025 allows individuals to shoot down unmanned aircraft (drones) flying within 200 feet of their property, provided they use a legally obtained shotgun and subject to state law. The bill also outlines reporting requirements to the FAA if the drone's registration number is known and defines 'shotgun.' Furthermore, it includes a clerical amendment to chapter 448 of title 49 of the United States Code. This Act aims to protect private property from drone intrusion.
